workflow.name: Mistral OCR, GPT-4o-mini, and Google Sheets integration for enhanced data processing
workflow.description:
Process multiple invoices automatically using Mistral's dedicated OCR model‚Äîat approximately $0.002 per page. Upload batches of PDF, PNG, or JPG invoices through a simple form, extract structured financial data with AI, validate results with confidence scoring, and save everything to Google Sheets.

## What this workflow does

1. Accepts multiple invoice uploads via n8n Form Trigger
2. Processes files in batch with rate limiting
3. Converts each file to base64 and sends to Mistral OCR API
4. Extracts 9 standard fields using GPT-4o-mini Information Extractor
5. Validates data and assigns confidence scores (high/medium/low)
6. Saves all results to Google Sheets with status tracking

## Fields extracted

Invoice Number, Date, Vendor Name, Tax ID, Subtotal, Tax Rate, Tax Amount, Total Amount, Currency

## Use cases

- Accountants processing client invoices in bulk
- Small businesses digitizing paper receipts
- Bookkeepers automating repetitive data entry
- Finance teams building searchable invoice databases

## Setup requirements

- Mistral API Key (console.mistral.ai) ‚Äî HTTP Header Auth credential
- OpenAI API Key (platform.openai.com)
- Google Sheets OAuth connection
- Google Sheet with 15 columns (template in workflow notes)

parameters.content:
## Invoice OCR Processor with Mistral AI

Automatically extract data from invoices using Mistral's dedicated OCR model and GPT-4o-mini. Process multiple PDF, PNG, or JPG invoices, extract financial fields, validate with confidence scoring, and save to Google Sheets.

### How it works
1. User uploads invoices via the form (supports multiple files)
2. Each file is converted to base64 and sent to Mistral OCR
3. GPT-4o-mini extracts structured invoice fields
4. Automatic validation assigns confidence scores
5. Results saved to Google Sheets with status tracking

### Setup steps
- [ ] Create Mistral API Key at console.mistral.ai
- [ ] Create OpenAI API Key at platform.openai.com
- [ ] Connect Google Sheets credentials
- [ ] Create a Sheet with the required columns
- [ ] Update `YOUR_GOOGLE_SHEET_ID` in the Sheets node

### Fields extracted
Invoice Number, Date, Vendor Name, Tax ID, Subtotal, Tax Rate, Tax Amount, Total, Currency

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Required Credentials

**1. Mistral API Key**
- Go to [console.mistral.ai](https://console.mistral.ai)
- Create HTTP Header Auth credential in n8n
- Header Name: `Authorization`
- Header Value: `Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE`

**2. OpenAI API Key**
- Standard OpenAI credential

**3. Google Sheets**
- Create Sheet with columns:
`Invoice Number | Invoice Date | Vendor Name | Vendor Tax ID | Subtotal | Tax Rate (%) | Tax Amount | Total Amount | Currency | Filename | Confidence | Status | Issues | Processed At | Pages`

parameters.formDescription: Upload one or more invoices (PDF, PNG, or JPG) to extract data automatically.

options.systemPromptTemplate: You are an invoice data extractor. Extract the requested fields precisely from the OCR text provided. Use dots for decimal separators (not commas). Return null for any field you cannot find. Format dates as YYYY-MM-DD.

attributes.name: invoice_number
attributes.description: The invoice number or document ID

attributes.name: vendor_tax_id
attributes.description: Tax ID, VAT, RFC, or business registration number

attributes.name: subtotal
attributes.description: Subtotal before taxes (number only, no currency symbol)

attributes.name: currency
attributes.description: Currency code (EUR, USD, MXN, GBP, etc.)
